Core Python.summary: This guide breaks down how long it takes to learn Python with realistic timelines, weekly study plans, and strategies to speed up your progress.

Core Python.title: Create Callable Instances With Python's .__call__()
Core Python.summary: Learn Python callables: what "callable" means, how to use dunder call, and how to build callable objects with step-by-step examples.

Core Python.title: GeoPandas Basics: Maps, Projections, and Spatial Joins
Core Python.summary: Dive into GeoPandas with this tutorial covering data loading, mapping, CRS concepts, projections, and spatial joins for intuitive analysis.

Core Python.title: Python's deque: Implement Efficient Queues and Stacks
Core Python.summary: Use a Python deque to efficiently append and pop elements from both ends of a sequence, build queues and stacks, and set maxlen for history buffers.

Core Python.title: Intro to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in Python

Core Python.title: Introduction to pandas
Core Python.summary: Learn pandas DataFrames: explore, clean, and visualize data with powerful tools for analysis. Delete unneeded data, import data from a CSV file, and more.

LLM.title: Categories of Inference-Time Scaling for Improved LLM Reasoning
LLM.summary: Inference scaling has become one of the most effective ways to improve answer quality and accuracy in deployed LLMs. The idea is straightforward. If we are willing to spend a bit more compute, and more time at inference time (when we use the model to generate text), we can get the model to produce better answers.

LLM.title: The State Of LLMs 2025: Progress, Problems, and Predictions
LLM.summary: A 2025 review of large language models, from DeepSeek R1 and RLVR to inference-time scaling, benchmarks, architectures, and predictions for 2026.

LLM.title: LLM Research Papers: The 2025 List (July to December)
LLM.summary: A curated list of LLM research papers from July–December 2025, organized by reasoning models, inference-time scaling, architectures, training efficiency, and diffusion.

LLM.title: Finetuning Falcon LLMs More Efficiently With LoRA and Adapters
LLM.summary: Finetuning allows us to adapt pretrained LLMs in a cost-efficient manner. But which method should we use? This article compares different parameter-efficient finetuning methods for the latest top-performing open-source LLM, Falcon. Using parameter-efficient finetuning methods outlined in this article, it's possible to finetune an LLM in 1 hour on a single GPU instead of a day on 6 GPUs.

LLM.title: Developing an LLM: Building, Training, Finetuning
LLM.summary: This is an overview of the LLM development process. This one-hour talk focuses on the essential three stages of developing an LLM: coding the architecture, implementing pretraining, and fine-tuning the LLM. Lastly, we also discuss the main ways LLMs are evaluated, along with the caveats of each method.

LLM.title: Principal Component Analysis
LLM.summary: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is a simple yet popular and useful linear transformation technique that is used in numerous applications, such as stock market predictions, the analysis of gene expression data, and many more. In this tutorial, we will see that PCA is not just a “black box”, and we are going to unravel its internals in 3 basic steps.
